item.title: Sharpening the Blade
item.description: *Written following week 12 Intro Goals are the currency of football, and it’s no secret that Sheffield United have severly lacked in this category. With 5 goals in twelve matches, the Blades are a far-cry from where they sat last year at this time. After 12 matches in the previous season, Sheffield United sat in a European position with 13 goals in their account. So why has the club parted ways with their elite company and found themselves at the bottom of the table?

Simon Fisher is a data analyst with a passion for applying mathematical and econometric analysis to football. He has experience working with multiple MLS clubs (Orlando City F.C., Nashville S.C.), as well a consulting with USMNT. Projects [Team Shape Analysis] [Offensive Repossession Ids]

Resources Books Soccermatics: Mathematical Adventures in the Beautiful Game Football Hackers: The Science and Art of a Data Revolution Soccernomics Money and Soccer: A Soccernomics Guide The Numbers Game: Why Everything You Know About Soccer Is Wrong Python Friends of Tracking FC Python
